subject: Tonight's the Night
event:
... well, sort of.

The HBO series of GAME OF THRONES does not debut for another two weeks.  April 17 is the big day.

But tonight those of you who have HBO will get a taste -- a special preview, the first fifteen minutes of episode one.

Be sure to give a watch.

And if you don't have HBO... well, hey, you've got two weeks to add it to your cable or satellite package.  (Those of you in the US, anyway.  Other countries have other arrangements for airing the series, each one different).

comments.article: the 15 minute preview should be added to the making game of thrones website for anyone right after the show unless something went wrong :)
comments.subject: 15 min preview

comments.article: Gah! Really? That would be great. Of course after watching I'd be walking like a zombie, going "more, more, more." :)
comments.subject: Re: 15 min preview

comments.article: My DVR is already set. I'll watch it first thing when I get home later tonight, you can be sure.

*flails* Over here in Dublin it's on the new Sky channel, which I don't get 'cause I'm not a Sky subscriber, which I am not only because they don't have a phone/internet/cable package and their not-nearly-as-nice competitors do. *flails sadly*!

I should probably call my provider and see if they're going to be, y'know. Providing it.
For some reason HBO-E is not showing it here with my cable provider so I'll have to watch it On-Demand or Online. But make sure either way I WILL see it. Looking forward to it!
I live in germany. Does anybody know of a legal way to watch the show?
I'm in Turkey, so I'll probably have to wait even longer than you!
It isn't listed in the TV Guide, so it must be on after some other program, but when???
Should be 8pm central/9 pm eastern, before Mildred Pierce I believe
DVR set. Silly work. @the lost collar. Im seeing it at 9pm EST after true blood.
Also I know HBO has posted at least one Game Of Thrones piece (the Behind the Throne segment) on HBO on demand. So people may be able to find it there after as well.
Does anyone know for sure one way or the other if AGOT will be available via Season Pass on iTunes?

I can't say *for sure*. However, HBO posts all of their shows to iTunes and Amazon. The one problem is, they wait until the DVD releases to do so, in order to not cut into DVD sales. So, you'll likely be waiting until the DVD release.
There's an HBO Canada, Georgie :P
comments.subject: hey!

comments.article:
no, we don't have any airing arrangements here in germany, wich is of course the fault of our terrible TV and movie market-managment. And when it will be finally aired after success is secured, after approcimately 1 year it will be only a synchronized version. With all the voices we allready know from oter tv shows anv movies. Its really horrible.
So what should the german fan do? Either he is well-behavingly waiting for the dvd to be released (maybe 2012?) or he seeks other ways...

sorry, I get a bad mood on that topic.
Strange...it's listed on HBO-L (The Spanish Version) at 9PM, but it's not listed on the regular HBO channel. I'll be looking for it at 9PM on HBO anyway and hope it's there!
For me as well, it's listed on the Spanish HBO, but not the regular one! I will tune in to the normal channel, hopefully it's just not listed.
High five! We just called and got HBO last week in prep for Game of Thrones! So excited for tonight, I've been rabidly posting on facebook to try to get friends and family in on it!
Added HBO to my cable package yesterday. I really hope they understand how many new subscribers this show is netting them. Is there a good way to let HBO know to help ensure future funding?
Am I the only fan who has HBO and is deliberately avoiding it?? I can't want until two Sundays from now, but just 15 minutes will be such a tease! I'm going to wait and watch the whole episode. :)
It certainly whet the appetite for the full show.

We're watching Mildred Pierce anyway (I'll pretty much watch anything with Kate Winslet), so it's an added bonus for us to get the first 15 minutes of GoT tonight as well!  Of course, I can't vouch for whether I'll actually pay any attention to MP after watching those 15 minutes....
The Others were BAD ASS!! Are they going to be referred to as Wight Walkers through out the series?
comments.subject: SAWEET!!!!

comments.article:
just saw it... ahhh ... splendid... aahhhhhhhhh

blue balls :-/ two more weeks...
Ok, the Others are creepy and very well done. :D

Stoked beyond words for the teaser this evening, even if it will make the pain of waiting all that much more acute.

Also, was that a Dexter reference in the title, Mr. Martin?
comments.subject: stoked

comments.article: OK, I'm a holdout on spoon fed media...but I got satellite installed last week. Hmmm...things have changed a bit since 1993, when I last had cable.
comments.subject: do I win?

comments.article: That was incredible. I know there's no such thing as a perfect adaptation of a book, but this is going to be as close and loving an adaptation as I've ever seen (based on 15 minutes of evidence :P). If the quality holds up, this will be epic.
I saw it and then HBO switched to another show... I didn't even realize that 15 minutes had gone by.  AAAUUUUUUUGGGGGGGHHHHHHH!
comments.subject: Such a tease!

comments.article:
I just don't get the changes to the prologue. It was still a great preview! Look forward to the series.

Also, was that one of The Others. Or a Wight that killed Waymar and Gared?
comments.subject: The others
